title: How can my father in law protect his assets, like home, some money in bank and 401K ?
question: He signed up for a federal student loan on behalf of his daughter. Now, he can not afford to repay loan as he makes minimum wage and he is 3-4 yrs from retirement.
question_tags: Bankruptcy,Debt,Nondischargeable debt and student loans,Bankruptcy and debt
answers: Get him to an experienced/reputable bankruptcy attorney familiar with discharging student loans in bankruptcy. A good bankruptcy attorney can discuss exemption planning (i.e. which assets are protected and which are not, etc.). Please feel free to a qualified attorney.

He can't protect assets that are otherwise available to creditors. Other forms of relief, specific to student loans, are possible, but confusing.

I hope he can help daughter with those.

If it is in fact a federal loan, (Parent Plus loan) it might be possible to consolidate that loan with other federal loans that the student (his daughter) has taken for education expenses. If she can consolidate the Parent Plus loan into a consolidation loan, she could then apply for income based repayment through the loan servicer. Either one of them can contact the loan servicer to find out about forbearance, repayment options or consolidation.

If it is is private loan (not a federal Parent Plus loan), he should discuss the circumstances with a debt collection defense attorney or student loan expert.
